All Ingredients: 1  Half Small Cucumber, 1  Medium Carrot, 1  Green Apple, cored, 3-4  Kale Leaves, 1  Big Handful Spinach Leaves, 1  Small Hunk Ginger, .5-1 oz Pastis Prado,Mint Sprig

Ingredients: 1.5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh pressed Apple Cider, 4 oz Hard Apple Cider, 1 stick Cinnamon stick
Preparation: Method:  Simmer on a gentle heat for 30 minutes and garnish with a cinnamon stick
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh pressed Apple Cider, 4 oz Hard Apple Cider, 1 stick Cinnamon stick,

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, 1 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Prickly Pear Puree, .5 oz Agave
Preparation: Mint salt on the rim. Garnish with mint sprig.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, 1 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Prickly Pear Puree, .5 oz Agave,Mint Sprig

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 1.5 oz Cream of Coconut, .5 oz Fresh pineapple juice, .5 oz Fresh lime juice, 3 dashes Angostura bitters
Preparation: Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth and icy. Pout into a glass and top with 3 dashes of angostura bitters.
All Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 1.5 oz Cream of Coconut, .5 oz Fresh pineapple juice, .5 oz Fresh lime juice, 3 dashes Angostura bitters,

Ingredients: 3 c Pink Pigeon Rum, 3 c Orange Juice, 3 c Pineapple Juice, 3 c Ginger Ale, .25 c Grenadine, 1  Fresh-Squeezed Lime Juice
Preparation: Mix all ingredients in a large pitcher, add ice, and enjoy!
All Ingredients: 3 c Pink Pigeon Rum, 3 c Orange Juice, 3 c Pineapple Juice, 3 c Ginger Ale, .25 c Grenadine, 1  Fresh-Squeezed Lime Juice,

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 5 oz Compas Box Great King Street Blended Scotch Whisky, 1 oz Byrrh Grand Quinquina, .5 oz Anchor Christmas Ale 2016*, 2 dash Bittercube Corazon Bitters, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters
Preparation:
Mix all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for 15-20 secs depending on the type of ice. Strain over a large rock and garnish with an orange peel expressing the oils over the cocktail.

*Anchor Christmas Ale 2016 w/ Honey (reduction) 2:1 (2-parts Beer to 1-part Honey)
All Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 5 oz Compas Box Great King Street Blended Scotch Whisky, 1 oz Byrrh Grand Quinquina, .5 oz Anchor Christmas Ale 2016*, 2 dash Bittercube Corazon Bitters, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters,Orange Peel

Ingredients: .75 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Blanc, .75 oz Oloroso & Moscatel Blend*, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Xocolate Bitters, 2 dash Orange Bitters,   Walnut Oil
Preparation:
Mix all ingredients in a tin except for the walnut oil. Utilizing the throwing technique, throw the mixture from one vessel to another vessel until chilled to air out the ingredients. Coat coupe glass with walnut oil and pour the mixture. Garnish with a dehydrated orange.

*Oloroso & Moscatel Blend:
-- 2 parts César Florido Moscatel Special
-- 1 part Lustau Oloroso Sherry

Blend ingredients.
All Ingredients: .75 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Blanc, .75 oz Oloroso & Moscatel Blend*, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Xocolate Bitters, 2 dash Orange Bitters,   Walnut Oil,Dehydrated Orange

Ingredients: .5 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .75 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .25 oz Simple Syrup, 1 oz Perfect Puree White Peach, 3 oz Soda Water
Preparation: Mix all ingredients together.
All Ingredients: .5 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .75 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .25 oz Simple Syrup, 1 oz Perfect Puree White Peach, 3 oz Soda Water,Luxardo Cherries

Ingredients: 1 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Orange Juice, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Batavia Arrack, .5 oz Simple Syrup, 1 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Mix all ingredients together.
All Ingredients: 1 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Orange Juice, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Batavia Arrack, .5 oz Simple Syrup, 1 dash Angostura Bitters,

Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, 1 oz Luxardo Bitter
Preparation: Mix all the liquid contents together in a heavy-bottomed tumbler with ice. Stir. Add a slice of orange and lemon zest to decorate.
All Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, 1 oz Luxardo Bitter,Orange Zest, Lemon Zest

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Bay Leaf-Infused Honey Syrup*, 2 oz Clover's Gingersnap, 1 pinch Cinnamon
Preparation: Mix all together and shake and double strain into a coupe without ice. *Bay Leaf-Infused Honey Syrup: • 3 cups honey to 1 cup water • 4 bay leaves, crumbled Bring to a boil. Stir until honey completely dissolves in water. Turn off heat and allow 2 hours to cool.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Bay Leaf-Infused Honey Syrup*, 2 oz Clover's Gingersnap, 1 pinch Cinnamon,

Ingredients: 1 part Junipero Gin, 1 part King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 part Campari, 1 part Sweet Vermouth
Preparation: Mix equal parts of the 4 spirits and age in a 5 liter oak barrel for 30 days. Transfer into glass bottles and rest for a minimum of 3 days. Make giant (2" x 2") ice cubes with an orange peel frozen inside. Pour negroni on ice cube and serve.
All Ingredients: 1 part Junipero Gin, 1 part King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 part Campari, 1 part Sweet Vermouth,

Ingredients: 37.5 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, 6.25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 12.5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 12.5 oz Sparkling Apple Juice, 6.25 oz Simple Syrup, 37.5 oz Seltzer
Preparation: Mix ingredients in the punch bowl.
All Ingredients: 37.5 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, 6.25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 12.5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 12.5 oz Sparkling Apple Juice, 6.25 oz Simple Syrup, 37.5 oz Seltzer,

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Christmas Spirit, 1 oz Oloroso Sherry, .25 oz Walnut Liqueur, 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 3 dash Pear Bitters
Preparation: Mix ingredients together then pour over crushed ice into a Julep tin. Dust with salt, sugar, and cinnamon.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Christmas Spirit, 1 oz Oloroso Sherry, .25 oz Walnut Liqueur, 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 3 dash Pear Bitters,

Ingredients: .75 oz No.3 London Dry Gin or H by HINE, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 dash Simple Syrup, 1 float Sparkling Wine
Preparation: Mix the gin or cognac, lemon juice and syrup in a cocktail shaker. Pour the contents into a Champagne flute. Top up with Champagne. Add a Luxardo Cherry or a peel of lemon.
All Ingredients: .75 oz No.3 London Dry Gin or H by HINE, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 dash Simple Syrup, 1 float Sparkling Wine,Lemon Peel, Luxardo Cherry

Cocktail Name: A MI MANERA (MY WAY) PISCO PUNCH
Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, 1 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 2 oz Minta Soda, 1 pinch Citric Acid or Lime Juice, 1 scoop Pineapple Sorbet
Preparation: Mix the Pisco, apricot liqueur and citric acid ingredients together in a punch bowl and allow to rest for 45 minutes. Place a large 2.2 lb. ice block 10 minutes before serving. Scoop the pineapple sorbet in a punch glass and fill up with the mix, top up with mint-flavored soda. Garnish with candied pineapple wheel from Dress the Drink.
All Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, 1 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 2 oz Minta Soda, 1 pinch Citric Acid or Lime Juice, 1 scoop Pineapple Sorbet,Candied Pineapple Wheel

Ingredients: .75 oz Blanco Tequila, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, .75 oz Fresh Lime Juice, .25 oz Rich Simple Syrup (2:1)
Preparation: Mount all ingredients in a shaker tin. Add ice. Hard shake. Double strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with orange twist.
All Ingredients: .75 oz Blanco Tequila, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, .75 oz Fresh Lime Juice, .25 oz Rich Simple Syrup (2:1),Orange Twist

Ingredients: 2.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Ginger Brown*, 4 dash Hella hula bitters, 3 beans Cocao beans
Preparation: Muddle 3 cacao beans in a mixing glass, add vodka, ginger-brown sugar, and Bitter Beast Hella Hula bitters. Add ice and vigorously shake to incorporate cacao flavor. Fine strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a cocao bean.
All Ingredients: 2.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Ginger Brown*, 4 dash Hella hula bitters, 3 beans Cocao beans,Cocoa bean

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Lime juice, .75 oz Simple syrup, 2  Mint leaves, muddled, 3  Cucumber slices, muddled
Preparation: Muddle 3-4 cucumber slices and a couple mint leaves. Shake and strain into martini or coupe glass. Garnish with lime or mint or cucumber.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Lime juice, .75 oz Simple syrup, 2  Mint leaves, muddled, 3  Cucumber slices, muddled,

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 oz Simple Syrup (1:1), 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 5 large Basil Leaves, 16 whole Black Peppercorns
Preparation: Muddle 4 basil leaves, 16 peppercorns and simple syrup in shaker tin. Add all other ingredients except final basil leaf. Add ice. Shake vigorously. Fine strain into chilled cocktail glass. Express lemon oil from lemon swath over drink. Garnish with lemon swath and final basil leaf.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 oz Simple Syrup (1:1), 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 5 large Basil Leaves, 16 whole Black Peppercorns,Lemon Swath, Basil Leaf

Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Fresh lime juice
Preparation:
Muddle a small handful of fresh mint leaves, ¾ oz simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water) 
1 oz fresh lime juice.
Add crushed ice to the glass to fill half way.
pour in 2 oz of Pink Pigeon.
Swizzle to incorporate ingredients and slowly add in the rest of the crushed ice.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Fresh lime juice,

Ingredients: 2 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Lime juice, .5 oz Cane sugar syrup, 2 oz Club soda
Preparation: Muddle basil in mixing glass, add all ingredients except club soda. Shake and strain into a collins glass, top with club soda.  Top with crushed ice and garnish with a basil sprig.
All Ingredients: 2 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Lime juice, .5 oz Cane sugar syrup, 2 oz Club soda,Basil Sprig

Ingredients: 2 oz Brandy, .5 oz Orange Cordial, 1 bsp Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, 1  Luxardo Cherry (muddled), 1 dash Aromatic Bitters, 1 dash Cherry Bitters
Preparation: Muddle cherry in liquid ingredients. Shake, double strain over cracked ice. Garnish with two more cherries on a pick with an orange flag.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Brandy, .5 oz Orange Cordial, 1 bsp Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, 1  Luxardo Cherry (muddled), 1 dash Aromatic Bitters, 1 dash Cherry Bitters,Luxardo Cherry

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, 3  Sun Gold Cherry Tomatoes, 4  Lovage Leaves, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Agave Syrup (1:1 agave to water), .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, 1 pinch Hepps Ghost Pepper Salt
Preparation: Muddle everything in a tin except Hophead. Then add Hophead and ice and shake and strain into a rocks glass with ice and garnish with a lovage sprig.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, 3  Sun Gold Cherry Tomatoes, 4  Lovage Leaves, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Agave Syrup (1:1 agave to water), .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, 1 pinch Hepps Ghost Pepper Salt,Lovage Sprig

Ingredients: 2.5 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, .25 oz Tippleman's Barrel Smoked Maple Syrup, 2 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 5 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 disc Orange, 1 disc Lemon, 1 slice Peach
Preparation: Muddle fruit, bitters and syrup. Add ice (1 large cube if available). Top with Whisky. Long stir.
All Ingredients: 2.5 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, .25 oz Tippleman's Barrel Smoked Maple Syrup, 2 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 5 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 disc Orange, 1 disc Lemon, 1 slice Peach,

Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Orange Juice, .5 oz Lemon, 1 bsp El Guapo Tonic Syrup, 4 dash El Guapo Tonic Bitters, 3  Cucumber Slices, 2  Mint Sprig
Preparation: Muddle mint and cucumber with the simple syrup in a shaker tin. Combine the remainder of the ingredients in the tin. Shake vigorously. Double strain with a fine mesh strainer into a collins glass. Fill with ice and garnish with a cucumber slice.
All Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Orange Juice, .5 oz Lemon, 1 bsp El Guapo Tonic Syrup, 4 dash El Guapo Tonic Bitters, 3  Cucumber Slices, 2  Mint Sprig,Cucumber slice

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, 1 oz Fresh Ginger Syrup, 1 slice Orange slice, 1 dash Chinese Five Spice Bitters
Preparation: Muddle Orange Slice. Add Nikka. Add Ginger Syrup. Stir over Ice. Add bitters.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, 1 oz Fresh Ginger Syrup, 1 slice Orange slice, 1 dash Chinese Five Spice Bitters,

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, .5 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 3 dash House-made Rasta Bitters
Preparation: Muddle orange twist with sugar. Add ice. Pour ingredients over ice. Add bitters
All Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, .5 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 3 dash House-made Rasta Bitters,Luxardo Cherry

Ingredients: 1 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, .5 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Lemon juice, 1 float Ginger beer, 4 pieces Chopped pineapple, 3 pieces Ginger root
Preparation: Muddle pineapple and ginger root, lemon juice and simple syrup, then add Aperitivo and rum, shake well, over ice and top up with Ginger beer.
All Ingredients: 1 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, .5 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Lemon juice, 1 float Ginger beer, 4 pieces Chopped pineapple, 3 pieces Ginger root,

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, 1 float Ginger beer, 4 pieces Pineapple, 4 pieces Ginger root
Preparation: Muddle pineapple and ginger root, lemon juice and simple syrup. Add rum. Shake well, over ice and top with ginger beer and Luxardo Bitter
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, 1 float Ginger beer, 4 pieces Pineapple, 4 pieces Ginger root,

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Peach Puree, .75 oz Lime Juice, 3  Raspberries, 1 oz Sparkling Wine
Preparation: Muddle raspberries in mixing glass. Add remainder of ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a well chilled coupe. Top off with sparkling wine. Garnish with raspberry and mint.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Peach Puree, .75 oz Lime Juice, 3  Raspberries
Preparation: Muddle raspberries in mixing glass. Add remainder of ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously strain over fresh ice. Garnish with raspberry and mint.

Muddle red pepper and mint. Add all other ingredients. Shake well over ice and strain into a chilled martini glass.

Ingredients: .5 tsp Demerara Sugar, 1  Roasted Cherry, 2 oz Cherry-Infused Vodka, .25 tsp Amaro di Angostura, .25 tsp Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 5 dash Miracle Mile Forbidden Barrel Aged Bitters
Preparation:
Muddle sugar and 1 roasted cherry in a rocks glass until the sugar has dissolved; add vodka, Amaro, Maraschino, and bitters and stir. Add 1 large ice cube and garnish with half a roasted cherry and the tarragon.

Cherry-Infused Vodka:
- 1 cup pitted cherries, quartered
- 1 cup vodka
Combine cherries and vodka in a bottle; cover, and let sit to meld the flavors for 3-5 days.
All Ingredients: .5 tsp Demerara Sugar, 1  Roasted Cherry, 2 oz Cherry-Infused Vodka, .25 tsp Amaro di Angostura, .25 tsp Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 5 dash Miracle Mile Forbidden Barrel Aged Bitters,Tarragon Sprig, Roasted Cherry

Preparation: Muddle the basil with the lime juice, then add tonic water. Fill glass with ice and stir in the gin.

Ingredients: 2  Kumquats, 2  Lychee, 2 oz Bulleit Rye, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Egg White, .5 oz Fever Tree Ginger Beer

Preparation: Muddle the pineapple adding more or less simple syrup as needed and depending on sweetness of the pineapple. Add all other ingredients. Give the mixture a hard shake. Double strain into chilled coupe.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz White Port, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Honey Cinnamon Syrup*, 1  Whole Egg, 8  Muddled Sage Leaves
Preparation:
Muddle the sage in a mixing tin. Add the remaining ingredients and dry shake (no ice) for 15 seconds. Add ice and shake another 15 seconds to chill down the drink. Double strain into a large coupe glass. Garnish with a whole star anise floated in the middle of the egg white.

*Honey Cinnamon Syrup:
-- 16 oz Honey
-- 2 Cinnamon Sticks
-- 8 oz Water
Combine all the ingredients together in a pot. Place on the stove and bring to a simmer, stirring the honey so it doesn’t burn and let the pot simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and place on an ice bath. Place in a container and label and date it. Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz White Port, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Honey Cinnamon Syrup*, 1  Whole Egg, 8  Muddled Sage Leaves,Whole Star Anise

Ingredients: 2 part Ypioca Brasilizar Cachaca Prata Reserva Especial, 1 part Fresh Lime Juice, 1 part Ancho Chile-Infused Simple Syrup, 1 float Ginger Beer, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation:
Punch Preparation Instructions:
Combine Ypioca, lime and syrup in bowl. Top with ginger beer and Angostura bitters* (amounts will depend on size of punch and number of anticipated servings). Garnish with thin-sliced dried ancho chiles and lime wheels to float. 

*You can optionally skip adding Angostura in punch and instead add a dash or 2 to each individual cocktail as served.


Individual Cocktail Preparation Instructions:
Combine ingredients exactly the same way as a traditional Moscow Mule over crushed ice. Garnish with dash or 2 bitters and ancho chile slices. Mint is an optional garnish.
All Ingredients: 2 part Ypioca Brasilizar Cachaca Prata Reserva Especial, 1 part Fresh Lime Juice, 1 part Ancho Chile-Infused Simple Syrup, 1 float Ginger Beer, 2 dash Angostura Bitters,Dried Ancho Chiles, Lime Wheel

Add a splash of bitter and muddle the sugar.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .75 oz Grapefruit Juice, .75 oz Ginger/Cardamom/Honey Syrup*, .25 oz Lime Juice,  float Tonic Water
Preparation:
Serve in a champagne flute up to 60% full and top with tonic water up to 80% full, garnish with a grapefruit twist.

*Ginger/Cardamom/Honey Syrup:
Bring about 8 cups of water to a boil, once boiling turn off heat and add 2 cups of cardamom pods. Let sit for about 6 hours. Strain the pods out, add 1 qt (32 oz) of honey and stir until dissolved. For an added cardamom boost: place the cardamom pods with the cardamom/honey "tea" in a blender. Blend and press through a fine strainer so as to discard the solids but keep the flavor.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .75 oz Grapefruit Juice, .75 oz Ginger/Cardamom/Honey Syrup*, .25 oz Lime Juice,  float Tonic Water,Grapefruit Twist

Ingredients: 2 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Serrano Pepper Syrup*, 1.5 oz Mango Juice, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation:
Serve in a julep cup with crushed ice and basil garnish.

*Serrano Pepper Syrup:
Take 6 serrano peppers. Slice 4 in half, carefully de-vein and seed them (this will take some of the heat away, make absolutely sure to wash your hands after handling the peppers, avoid touching anything unless you've washed your hands), place a skillet on medium to high heat and roast the peppers until they are a little charred. Once charred place in a blender with about 2 cups of water and throw in the 2 remaining fresh serranos (seeds and all). Blend and strain out the solids. Add 1 cup of demarara sugar to the serrano pepper water and stir until it is dissolved.
All Ingredients: 2 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Serrano Pepper Syrup*, 1.5 oz Mango Juice, 2 dash Angostura Bitters,Basil

*Rich Brown Sugar Simple Syrup: 
-- 2 cups Brown Sugar
-- 1 cup Water

*Pumpkin-Infused Glenrothes Vintage Reserve:
Peel, clean and cut small 2x2 in. pieces of sugar pumpkin. Salt very lightly and roast for about 20 mins. at 250°F. Put into a sealed container with scotch and let rest for 2 days. Strain off the pumpkin and re-bottle. Keep refrigerated.

Preparation:
Shake with ice and strain into a footed pilsner glass. Add a few drops of bitters. Garnish with a mint leaf. 

*Strawberry & Black Pepper Shrub:
-- 1 cup Sliced Strawberries
-- 1 cup Granulated Sugar
-- 1 cup Champagne Vinegar
-- 1 handful of Black Balinese Peppers

Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl. Using a potato masher or a wooden spoon, mash the berries so they release their juices. Stir until the sugar has mostly dissolved and refrigerate overnight.
The next day, remove the mixture to a saucepan and heat gently over medium-low heat. Do not bring to a simmer--you simply want to heat the mixture to coax the sugar to dissolve.
Strain the shrub through a fine mesh strainer. If desired, strain again through a coffee filter. Refrigerate.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Strawberry & Black Pepper Shrub*, .75 oz Hidalgo La Gitana Manzanilla Sherry, .5 oz Lemon Juice , few drops Peychaud's Bitters,Mint Leaf

Ingredients: 1 oz Mezcal, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .75 oz Coconut Pistachio Puree*, .75 oz Lemon Juice
Preparation:
Shake with ice in a mixing glass for about 15 seconds to properly chill. Double strain into a small fizz glass over ice.

*Coconut Pistachio Puree:
-- .5 lb Pistachios (toasted)
-- 1.5 lbs Sugar (144 oz.)
-- 11 oz Coconut Milk
-- 13 oz Water
-- 1 tsp Salt

Toast the pistachios at 250°F for 20 mins. Remove and put in a blender with sugar until well chopped. Combine all the ingredients in a pot and bring to a boil. Let simmer for 20 mins and then remove from the heat. Let cool and place in a large container. Let the mixture sit overnight then strain out the solids. Save the solids to spin in the ice cream maker (if you have one). Spin the solids and add the mixture back into the puree via chinois. Bottle, label and date the syrup (it will keep indefinitely if you freeze it).
All Ingredients: 1 oz Mezcal, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .75 oz Coconut Pistachio Puree*, .75 oz Lemon Juice,Candied Ginger

*Blood Orange Vanilla Mint Puree:
-- 1 container Boiron Blood Orange Puree (34 oz.)
-- 39 grams Mint (stems and leaves)
-- 1 tsp Vanilla Extract
-- 30 oz White Sugar

Combine all the ingredients except the mint in a pot. 
Bring to a light simmer, stirring to incorporate everything.
Then add the mint and cook for 5 minutes, then remove the pot from the heat and strain through a chinois to remove the mint.
Label and date a container, then place in your fridge. Use within a week.

Shaken slightly. Served over shaved ice in an old fashioned glass. Garnished with turmeric toasted coconut flakes.

*Toasted Coconut Infused Old Potrero
-- 750ml Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey
-- 2.5 oz Toasted Coconut

Combine all ingredients in a clean container and let sit for 8 hours.
Strain through cheesecloth and then funnel back into your Old Potrero bottles.
Keeps indefinitely.

**Turmeric Coconut Cream:
-- 12 g Fresh Turmeric
-- 1 c Water
-- 1 c Honey
-- 3 tsp Black Pepper
-- 12 oz Coconut Milk

Grate fresh turmeric into 1 cup water.
Bring to a boil, add 1 cup of honey and stir.
Remove from heat and let the mix sit for 1:30 hours.
Strain out turmeric and add 3 tsp. ground black pepper.
Add 12 oz. coconut milk and stir.
Place in an airtight container and keep in the fridge. Use within a week.
All Ingredients: 1.25 oz Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey (Toasted Coconut Infused)*, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1.25 oz Turmeric Coconut Cream**,Turmeric Toasted Coconut Flakes

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Beet Thyme Reduction*, .5 oz Licor 43, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5  Egg White
Preparation:
Shaken without ice, then with ice and strained into a large coupe. Garnished with candied thyme.

*Beet Thyme Reduction
-- 520 grams raw beets 
-- 344 grams honey
-- 2 oranges peeled (just the peels)
-- 2 sprigs of thyme
-- pinch of salt

Juice beets, add honey and let dissolve and cook for 15 mins. 
Add thyme and simmer for 5 more mins. 
Strain through a chinois into a container and then place in the fridge.
This makes 1 quart, so multiply as needed.
Use within 1 week.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Beet Thyme Reduction*, .5 oz Licor 43, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5  Egg White,Candied Thyme

Ingredients: 2 oz Ypioca Cachaca Prata*, 1 oz Passion fruit juice, 1 oz Condensed milk

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 bsp Pomegranate Cordial*, 1.25 oz Brachetto, 1  Sugar Cube, 8 dash Tempus Fugit Abbott's Bitters
Preparation:
Soak cube in 8 dashes Abbott's Bitter. Drop sugar cube into bottom of flute glass. Stir, Luxardo, gin, and pomegranate cordial. Strain into flute glass. Top with Brachetto. Garnish with small rose, dipped in rose flower water.

*Pomegranate Cordial:
-- 48 oz Pomegranate Juice
-- 2.5 lbs White Sugar
-- 1 lb Turbinado Sugar
-- 8 Course Cracked Black Peppercorns
-- 2 Cloves
-- 5 Allspice Berries
-- 1 Tbsp Pomegranate Molasses
-- 1 oz Orange Flower Water

Mix all ingredients together in large saucepan. Stir on medium heat until all sugar is dissolved. Strain of spices. Bottle.

Ingredients: .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 1.5 oz Bols Genever, .5 oz Clarified Coconut Sugar Blood Orange Cordial*, 1 dash Copper & Kings Absinthe
Preparation:
Spray vessel with absinthe as a rinse. Build cocktail in a stirring glass. Stir cocktail. Place a large format cube in the vessel. Pour cocktail over large format cube. 

To garnish, peel a blood orange skin and express the oils over the cocktail. Grab mint sprigs and slap over the top of hand to express oils, wrap the peel at the base of the mint sprigs, tie off with twine and set on top of large format cube.

*Clarified Coconut Sugar Blood Orange Cordial:
-- Blood Oranges
-- Agar Agar
-- Coconut Sugar

Juice blood oranges. Bring 1/4 of juice to a boil with agar agar. Pour cooked juice into the remaining 3/4 juice. Freeze the juice. Pull the block from the freezer and let drip through cheese cloth and perforated pan creating the clarified juice. Bring the juice together with a rich (2:1) coconut sugar creating a coconut sugar blood orange cordial.
All Ingredients: .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 1.5 oz Bols Genever, .5 oz Clarified Coconut Sugar Blood Orange Cordial*, 1 dash Copper & Kings Absinthe,Blood Orange Skin, Mint Sprigs

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pumpkin vodka, .75 oz New York Apple Whisky, .75 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Hot water
Preparation: Steam in steaming tin. Pour in Demitasse glass. Top with heavy whipping cream and nutmeg.
All Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pumpkin vodka, .75 oz New York Apple Whisky, .75 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Hot water,

Ingredients: 750 ml bottle Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 5 sprigs Dill, 2 cloves Crushed Garlic, 1  Lemon Peel (white pith removed and julienned), 1 Tbsp Whole Peppercorns
Preparation:
Step one: Infuse the vodka
- Transfer ingredients including 750 ml of Karlsson's vodka to a canning jar or glass container. Close the container.
- Shake and rotate every few hours. Let infuse for 24 hours total.
- After 24 hours, strain the vodka through a cheesecloth or nutmilk bag.
- Transfer the vodka to a glass bottle. Store in the refrigerator or freezer until use.

Step two: Make the martini
- Stir 2-3 oz, depending on preference, of the infused vodka with ice.
- Strain into a chilled martini glass.
- Add pickled onions and peppers.
All Ingredients: 750 ml bottle Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 5 sprigs Dill, 2 cloves Crushed Garlic, 1  Lemon Peel (white pith removed and julienned), 1 Tbsp Whole Peppercorns,

Ingredients: 750 ml bottle Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 5 oz Pomegranate Juice, 9 oz Cranberry Juice, 9 oz Aperol, 4 oz Simple Syrup (equal parts sugar and water), 3  Star Anise, 5  Cloves, 4  Allspice Berries, 3  Cinnamon Sticks, 2 oz Orange Peel
Preparation: Toast spices and set aside. Bring cranberry juice to a simmer. Tie the spices and orange peel in cheesecloth and add them to the cranberry juice. Let this simmer for about 30 minutes. Remove the spice sachet and add the other liquid ingredients. Serve warm or chilled with orange wheels as a garnish. (The magic of punches is that you can adjust them to your liking as you make them, so please play around with different juices and proportions.)

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Anejo Tequila, 1 tsp Cinnamon-Clove Syrup*, 4 drops Bittermens Hellfire Habanero Shrub Bitters, 1 peel Grapefruit
Preparation:
Using a grater, slice 1 peel of grapefruit into a double old-fashioned glass, angling into the glass in order to get the expressed citrus. Then add Cinnamon-Clove Syrup and 3 large ice cubes.

Separately, in a large mixing glass full of ice, pour in Chinaco Anejo Tequila. Using a barspoon, stir for 28-33 rotations. Strain tequila into prepared glass. Add 4 drops of Bittermens Hellfire Bitters. Garnish and enjoy.

*Cinnamon-Clove Syrup:  
-- 2 C Water
-- 1 C Demarea Sugar
-- 4-5 Cinnamon Sticks
-- 7-9 Cloves

Combine Water and Demarea in a pot and bring to a simmer until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. Add Cinnamon Sticks and Cloves and let steep. Leave at room temperature, overnight. Once cooled, strain into a squeeze bottle and refrigerate.
All Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Anejo Tequila, 1 tsp Cinnamon-Clove Syrup*, 4 drops Bittermens Hellfire Habanero Shrub Bitters, 1 peel Grapefruit,Grapefruit Peel

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Creme de Cacao, 1 oz Cream (steamed as for a cappuccino)
Preparation:
Warm and flame H by Hine VSOP Fine Champagne in metal mug like a Blue Blazer without the tossing back and forth.
Douse flame of heated brandy with cacao, top with foamed cream.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
All Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Creme de Cacao, 1 oz Cream (steamed as for a cappuccino),Nutmeg

Ingredients: 1 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 1 oz Cognac, .5 oz Benedictine, 1 tincture Angostura Bitters, 1 tincture Peychaud's Bitters, 1 pc Lemon Twist, 1 pc Orange Twist,   Peanut Butter Powder
Preparation: Wet half of the rim of a 13 oz. rocks glass with Benedictine. Shake off the excess Benedictine to avoid clumping on the rim and dip it into the peanut butter powder. Flick the glass to shake the excess powder off. Place the glass in a cooler to chill the glass. In a frozen mixing glass combine all liquid ingredients with equal parts cracked ice and whole hard ice. Stir the cocktail for 45 seconds. Remove the glass from the cooler and place a 2 in. hard ice cube in it. Double strain the cocktail into the glass. Spritz the cocktail with both of the twists. Make sure to release all the essential oils into the cocktail. Discard the twists.
All Ingredients: 1 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 1 oz Cognac, .5 oz Benedictine, 1 tincture Angostura Bitters, 1 tincture Peychaud's Bitters, 1 pc Lemon Twist, 1 pc Orange Twist,   Peanut Butter Powder,

Ingredients: Caramel coloring, Vodka, Vanilla, Coffee, Sugar, Water,
Preparation: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.
All Ingredients: Caramel coloring, Vodka, Vanilla, Coffee, Sugar, Water, ,

Ingredients: Coffee liqueur, Chocolate liqueur, Mezcal,
Preparation:
To ensure that your pork fat is just as delicious as theirs, here’s their adobo marinade and what to do with it (you’ll also need a rack of ribs):

4 ancho chiles, 8 guajillo chiles and 4 chipotle chiles, plus 4 cloves roasted garlic, half a cup of cider vinegar, a quarter teaspoon of Mexican oregano, 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper, a whole clove, a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a half teaspoon of ground cumin.

Toast the dried chiles and soak in water for at least an hour until they are rehydrated. Drain and discard the soaking liquid. Combine the soaked chiles with the remaining ingredients and purée until smooth.

Cold smoke a rack of baby back pork ribs by taking a large hotel pan with woodchips on one side and charcoal on the other. Place another, smaller, pan with pork ribs, above the charcoal/woodchip pan. Ignite the charcoal, being careful to not ignite the woodchips. Cover both pans with foil and allow to smoke for 10-15 minutes, until desired level of smoke is achieved, then coat with adobo marinade and wrap in tin foil prior to placing ribs in a 300 degree oven for 7 hours. When the ribs have cooled, strain off the fat and use for the infusion.

If you’re having a hard time coming up to the same kind of volume of fat, make up the balance with pork lard from a butcher. To get the same depth of flavor without the ribs, heat up the fat in a pot with a few spoons of the marinade.

Once you’ve got your tub of seasoned pork fat in cooled liquid form, pour equal amounts of Ilegal Joven mezcal and fat into a sealable container. Seal the container and give it a really good shake, then put it in the freezer overnight. When the whole thing is separated and congealed, pour it through a fine mesh chinoise. If you don’t have a chinoise, try a fine mesh strainer, or if you don’t have one of those, try spooning off most of the fat. There will be some beads of orange fat left in the strained mezcal: run that through a few layers of cheesecloth (or coffee filters in a pinch) to get rid of the last of it.

The mezcal is now ready for drinking, straight-up or in a cocktail. 

Habanero tincture

Slice habaneros and add 2 ounces Ilegal Joven mezcal.
Allow to sit overnight or until desired level of heat is achieved.
Cocktail

Combine mezcal and chocolate liqueur in a mixing glass with ice and stir for 45 seconds.
Strain into chilled coupe.
Carefully "sink" the coffee liqueur down the inside of the coupe over a spoon.
Garnish with 5 drops habanero tincture.
All Ingredients: Coffee liqueur, Chocolate liqueur, Mezcal, ,

Ingredients: Vodka, Ginger, Cloves, Red Chili Flakes, Orange Peel, Cherry Juice,
Preparation:
Tip the cherry juice, orange peel, chilli, cinnamon sticks, cloves and ginger into a large saucepan. Simmer for 5 mins, then turn off the heat. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 4 hrs, or up to 2 days – the longer you leave it the more intense the flavours. If serving to young children, take the chilli out after a few hours.

When you’re ready to serve, pour the juice into a jug. Serve in glass bottles or glasses and pop a straw in each. If you're adding vodka, do so at this stage. Dangle a fangs sweet from each glass.

Ingredients: Salt, Sugar Syrup, Lime Juice, Orange Juice, Tomato Juice, Tequila,
Preparation: Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first "rim" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended.
All Ingredients: Salt, Sugar Syrup, Lime Juice, Orange Juice, Tomato Juice, Tequila, ,

Preparation:
Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds.

Pour into a glass, add ice cubes to fill, then add the garnish.

*Donn’s mix: Bring 3 crushed cinnamon sticks, 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.

Simmer for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle.

Then add 1 part of the syrup and 2 parts of fresh grapefruit juice together.
